title: Alacritty receive characters when I use a shortcut to switch between XFCE desktop.
body:
On XFCE, when I switch from virtual desktops with the shortcut Ctrl+Shift+Right or Left, when I come back to Alacritty, it prints a character, `C` (when I come back with Ctrl+Shift+Right) or `D` (with Ctrl+Shift+Left).

It is the only terminal emulator to do this, xfce4-terminal and terminator are not affected.

When I disable the shortcut in XFCE, all terminal emulators does print C or D when I do Ctrl+Shift+Right or Ctrl+Shift+Left.

I have no problem with Alacritty 0.3.3.

### System

OS: Linux
Version: alacritty 0.4.0 (b115b90)
Linux: X11

### Logs

Here is the output of `alacritty --print-events`, truncated from the press of Ctrl to the release of Ctrl.
What I exactly did:
- Start Alacritty
- Click the virtual desktop on the left
- Go back to the fist desktop with Ctrl+Shift+Right.
